page.title: 02PHYSICAL BACKGROUND
page.content: The area lies on the south-facing dip slope of the Chiltern Hills and in the valley of the River Ver. It ranges in height between 315 feet in the south and 499 feet in the north-east. The valley of the Ver is virtually dry in this section due mainly to the large amounts of water which have been extracted from the chalk acquifer for example at the Friars Wash pumping station. Water is now only found in the dried up bed in times of heavy rainfall or locally as small, marshy areas. The gradient of the valley side is gentle, averaging 1:33 and the landscape could best be described as gently rolling countryside.
